definition: to stare blankly/to look on helplessly/to look on unfeelingly
eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)

sentences.english: Can you, of allthe people who love her, bear to see her so?
sentences.chinese: 在这么多爱她的人中，你能眼睁睁看着她这样么？

sentences.english: I can't stand to see him cry like that.
sentences.chinese: 我不能眼睁睁看着他哭成那样。

sentences.english: Sasuke is looking at the fleeing Danzo and reaches his arm out.
sentences.chinese: 佐助眼睁睁的看着团藏逃跑了。

sentences.english: I can't open my eyes to watch you jumping into the fiery pit, for I will shut my eyes at the time.
sentences.chinese: 我不会眼睁睁看着你往火坑里跳，到时候我会闭上的。

sentences.english: Pandu watched him go, thinking that he ought to say something to him.
sentences.chinese: 潘杜眼睁睁地看着他离去，心想自己应该说些什么。

sentences.english: You are about to see them die.
sentences.chinese: 你只能眼睁睁看他们死去。

sentences.english: You will eventually watch as she and another man left to go.
sentences.chinese: 你最后会眼睁睁的看着她和另一个人走了去的。

sentences.english: And let it see roll back down again.
sentences.chinese: 再眼睁睁的看着它滚下来。

sentences.english: How can people possibly be relaxed as we watch our savings disappear?
sentences.chinese: 眼睁睁看着自己的存款消失时我们怎么可能会轻松？

sentences.english: Looking you go ahead to the far and disappear in the dark.
sentences.chinese: 眼睁睁看着你走远，你的身影消失在暗夜里。

sentences.english: I cannot die of thirst with water close by.
sentences.chinese: 我不能眼睁睁在水边渴死。

sentences.english: Su destroys snow Cu eyebrow, helplessly canning be hugged by the other celebration oneself is in the breast.
sentences.chinese: 苏残雪蹙眉，眼睁睁的任由对方将自己抱在怀里。

sentences.english: Helpless, we watched half a year's food destroyed before our eyes.
sentences.chinese: 我们毫无办法，眼睁睁地看着半年的粮食给毁掉了。

definition: to let (sb do sth)/to allow/regardless of
have no way out/have no alternative/abbr. to 無奈|无奈[wu2 nai4]
no strategy left to try (idiom); at one's wit's end/at the end of one's tether/powerless
to see with one's own eyes/very soon
to accept misfortunes as decreed by fate/to be resigned to sth
to have the heart to do sth/to steel oneself to a task
